space.arim.universal.util.collections

Class ErringCollectionsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.universal.util.collections.ErringCollectionsUtil

  • public final class ErringCollectionsUtil
extends Object
    Utility class similar to CollectionsUtil but whose methods throw exceptions and accept erring functions.

    Designed to reduce boilerplate operations.
    Author:
    A248

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • wrapAll

        public static <T,X extends Throwable> T[] wrapAll(T[] original,
                                                  ErringUnaryOperator<T,X> wrapper)
                                           throws X extends Throwable
        Mutates the input array, setting each element to ErringFunction.apply(Object)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the array
        X - the type of the exception
        Parameters:
        original - the input array
        wrapper - the ErringUnaryOperator to wrap each element
        Returns:
        the mutated array where each element has been replaced with UnaryOperator.wrap(previous element)
        Throws:
        X - according to ErringFunction.apply(T)
        X extends Throwable

      • checkForAnyMatches

        public static <T,X extends Throwable> boolean checkForAnyMatches(Collection<T> collection,
                                                                 ErringPredicate<? super T,X> checker)
                                                          throws X extends Throwable
        Same as CollectionsUtil.checkForAnyMatches(Collection, Predicate) but uses an ErringPredicate instead.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the collection
        X - the type of the exception
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection across which to iterate
        checker - used when checking an element
        Returns:
        true if and only if checker.apply(element) returns true for any element
        Throws:
        X - according to ErringPredicate.test(Object)
        X extends Throwable
